attributes.action: Restrict social security benefits for claimants who commit criminal offences
attributes.background: A disproportionate number of those who took part in the recent riots, looting & acts of vandalism were on social security benefit. Anyone on such benefits who is found guilty of a criminal offence must have their benefit payments deducted until triple the cost of the damage caused is paid off.

rejection.details: We understand that you want the Government to change benefit entitlements for certain people, but decisions about compensation for criminal damage are a matter for the courts, not the Government or House of Commons. There are already mechanisms for courts to fine perpetrators of criminal damage, and to deduct fines from benefits.
